INTERSHOP IOM 4.1.0-SNAPSHOT Database Model   (revision 962baef2587378a8bf3b645adc86ebb8ca52b8e4)

Table oms.ShopOrderValidationDO

List of all rule sets for order validation which checks the availability of information to corresponding properties of an order message.
It can be configured whether a field should have a value or not.

Columns 

References[1] Column Type Constraints[2] Default Comment
id bigint PK, UNIQUE, NOT_NULL  
articleId boolean Check for article Id. 
commercialRegister boolean Check for commercial register information. 
companyName boolean Check for company name. 
companyType boolean Check for company type. 
costNo boolean Check for cost center number. 
department boolean Check for department name. 
ean boolean Check for EAN. 
lineOfBusiness boolean Check for line of business information. 
purchaseGross boolean Check for purchase price gross. 
purchaseNet boolean Check for purchase price net. 
purchaseTax boolean Check for purchase price tax. 
salesGross boolean Check for sales price gross. 
salesNet boolean Check for sales price net. 
salesTax boolean Check for sales price tax. 
shopCustomerNo boolean Check for shop customer number. 
shopOrderNo boolean Check for shop order number. 
shopSelectedSupplierId boolean Check for selected supplier Id. 
vatNo boolean Check for VAT number. 
singlePositionArticle boolean Check for single position article information. 
name varchar(255) UNIQUE, NOT_NULL The name of the validation set. Example "B2C Invoicing Rules Set" 
orderAddressEmailRequired boolean false Check for email in the order address. 

[1] Not all references are enforced by a foreign key where they could.
Such "missing" foreign keys are denoted with [[ ]].

[2] Constraints:
PK : the column is part of the primary key
UNIQUE: does don't cover unique constraints and indexes defined on more than one column.
